data.question: What is the title of the article?
Who are the authors of the article?
data.answer: Jiancan Yu, Yuanjing Cui, Chuan-De Wu, Yu Yang, Banglin Chen, Guodong Qian

data.question: What is the DOI of the article?
What type of material is discussed in the article?
What is the main application of the two-photon responsive MOF mentioned in the article?
data.answer: Two-photon patterning and imaging in high-resolution 3D structure

data.question: Is the two-photon responsive MOF capable of fluorescence change under UV light and infrared femtosecond laser?
What is the chemical formula of the zwitterionic linker used in the synthesis of the MOF?
Can the MOF retain its original crystal structure after UV light irradiation?
What is the emission peak wavelength of ZJU-56–0.20 before UV light exposure?
Does the fluorescence color of the MOF change from blue to yellow after UV light exposure?
What is the role of the zwitterionic linker in the MOF's fluorescence change?
data.answer: The zwitterionic linker undergoes a photochemical reaction under UV light, leading to the fluorescence change.

data.question: Is the photochemical reaction of the zwitterionic linker reversible?
What is the spatial resolution achieved by the two-photon patterning in the MOF?
Does the MOF exhibit two-photon excited fluorescence change when exposed to a 900 nm laser?
What is the significance of using a 710 nm laser for patterning in the MOF?
data.answer: The 710 nm laser can induce photochemical reactions and emission around 550 nm without affecting unaddressed areas.

data.question: Is the two-photon excited fluorescence pattern in the MOF stable over time?
What is the potential application of the 3D two-photon excited fluorescence pattern in the MOF?
Does the MOF ZJU-56 exhibit fluorescence color change after UV light illumination?
What is the publication year of the article?
What is the main advantage of using two-photon processing in MOFs?
data.answer: It allows for spatial modulation of the fluorescence property of the MOF in three dimensions.
